newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS THURSDAY MIXED ON UNITS.
newsitem.headline: ZIMBABWE DOLLAR ENDS THURSDAY MIXED ON UNITS.

text.p: The Zimbabwe dollar gained slightly over the U.S. dollar but was quoted softer on sterling, the mark and the rand at the close of Thursday's interbank trading session, dealers said.
"There wasn't much happening today. We didn't see any big volumes of trade though the Zimbabwe dollar appreciated slightly (on the back of foreign currency inflows)," a dealer said.

The Zimbabwe unit ended the day at 11.3975/4075 on the U.S. dollar, slightly firmer compared to Wednesday's 11.4000/4100 but tumbled to 19.1520/1900 against sterling from 18.8930/9250, tracking a weaker U.S. dollar overseas.
It was also quoted easier on the mark at 6.5215/1900 compared to 6.5020/5140 and at 2.5175/5275 from 2.5150/5190 versus the rand.
